meanings.definition: Recognize or treat (someone or something) as different.
meanings.sent1: I can distinguish between the two identical twins easily.
meanings.sent2: She can distinguish the taste of salt from sugar.
meanings.sent3: The detective could not distinguish the real painting from the fake one.
meanings.sent4: His unique talent in art distinguishes him from other students.
meanings.sent5: The bright red color of the flower helps it distinguish itself in the garden.

meanings.definition: Perceive or point out a difference.
meanings.sent1: Can you distinguish the sound of a dog from a cat?
meanings.sent2: He could distinguish the subtle change in her tone of voice.
meanings.sent3: The robot was programmed to distinguish between right and wrong.
meanings.sent4: Her keen eyes could distinguish the smallest details in the painting.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to distinguish the main idea from the supporting details.

meanings.definition: Make (someone or something) stand out from others.
meanings.sent1: The bright spotlight helped distinguish the lead singer on stage.
meanings.sent2: Her unique style of painting distinguishes her work from others.
meanings.sent3: The colorful hat really distinguishes you in the crowd.
meanings.sent4: His exceptional speed in running distinguishes him as the fastest in the team.
meanings.sent5: The strong aroma of the dish distinguishes it as a specialty of the restaurant.
